</TR>
</TABLE></CENTER>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
goal weights and threshold, target, and maximum performance levels are specified on the attached goal sheet.</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>EVA
Improvement is the dollar amount of planned year-over-year improvement in EVA. If the previous year (FY 1999) EVA Improvement
was below the threshold level, the current year (FY 2000) EVA Improvement will be calculated using the previous year's (FY 1999) threshold level EVA amount.
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="3",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]DE3280B.;27',USER='MSPASOJ',CD='30-DEC-1999;14:44' -->
</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Individual Performance</I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
addition to the goals indicated above, an individual performance factor will be applied to the calculation of your MIP payout. The factor ranges from 50% to 150% of your overall payout.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>VII.&nbsp;&nbsp;MINIMUM PERFORMANCE PAYOUT REQUIREMENTS</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>To
ensure protection of shareholder interest before an incentive payout can be generated, the following criteria must be met:</FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<CENTER><TABLE WIDTH="63%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>

</TR>

<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="45%"><FONT SIZE=2>ADC EVA must be positive and;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="45%"><FONT SIZE=2>ADC EVA must be positive and;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="45%"><FONT SIZE=2>The threshold level of ADC Revenue or ADC EVA Improvement must be met</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="45%"><FONT SIZE=2>The threshold level of ADC EVA Improvement or Group and/or Division EVA Improvement or Group or Division Revenue must be met</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></CENTER>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>VIII.&nbsp;CALCULATION OF PAYMENTS</B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>A.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Determination of Achievement Against Goals and Obligation to Make Payments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT
SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
obligation to make payments under the Plan will be determined by achievement of goals determined by the Board of Directors.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
payout opportunity for meeting threshold, target and maximum goal levels are as follows:</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="76%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="32%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Threshold</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="32%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Target</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="32%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Maximum</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="32%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>0% of Target Incentive Opportunity</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>100% of Target Incentive Opportunity</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>300% of Target Incentive Opportunity</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Results
between threshold-target and target-maximum are interpolated.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Your
individual target incentive opportunity is indicated on your participant form</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>B.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Calculation of individual payments under this plan is a function of:</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT
SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Target
incentive opportunity&#151;expressed as a percentage of an individual's FY 2000 earnings.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Participant's
2000 fiscal year base salary earnings.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Performance
against the established goals.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Individual
performance factor.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>C.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Individual award calculations are shown by the following example:</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Assume
we have a Group Plan participant with the following facts:</FONT></P>
</UL>
</UL>

</TR>

<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>

<TD WIDTH="21%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TD WIDTH="7%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>20</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="17%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>100</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="21%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="51%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Overall Result as % of Target</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="17%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>101</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="21%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="51%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Individual Performance Factor</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="17%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>100</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="21%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="3",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]DE3280B.;27',USER='MSPASOJ',CD='30-DEC-1999;14:44' -->
</FONT></P>

<!-- Generated by Merrill Corporation (www.merrillcorp.com) -->
<UL>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Calculation
of Payment:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>$70,000
(FY Earnings)&nbsp;&times;&nbsp;15% (Target Incentive Opportunity)&nbsp;&times;&nbsp;101% (Overall Result as a % of Target)&nbsp;&times;&nbsp;100% (Individual
Performance Factor) =$10,605.</FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>IX.&nbsp;&nbsp;EFFECT OF CHANGE IN EMPLOYMENT STATUS</B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>A.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Termination of Employment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;A participant who terminates employment for any reason prior to the end of the Fiscal Year
receives no payment under the Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>B.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Change Based Upon Promotion or Demotion To Another Eligible Plan Job With the Same MIP Goals.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;A current participant
who is promoted or demoted from an incentive eligible position to another incentive eligible position with the same MIP goals during the fiscal year has a pro rata calculation of payment based upon
the time served in each position during the Fiscal Year, provided at least three months was served in each position. If a participant is in an eligible position for less than three months during the
fiscal year, the payment calculation is based on the incentive level of the position served in the longest.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>C.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Change in Jobs Within the Company but not Eligible for a Management Incentive Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;A participant who changes jobs
within the Company but is not eligible for this Plan, retains the right to a pro rata payout under this Plan based on the length of time in the eligible position provided at least three months was
served in the eligible position.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>D.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Change Based Upon a Transfer.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;A transfer is defined as a change in position which results in the MIP participant
working under new MIP goals. How a transfer payout is calculated is based on the quarter in which the effective date occurs. The guideline is as follows:</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="72%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="23%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=1><B>Fiscal Year Qtr<BR>
of Effective Date<BR></B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="75%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>&nbsp;<BR>
Impact on MIP<BR>
Payout Calculation</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="23%"><FONT SIZE=2>1<SUP>st</SUP> Quarter</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="75%"><FONT SIZE=2>Payout is based on the new MIP goals for the entire fiscal year</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="23%"><FONT SIZE=2>2<SUP>nd</SUP> &amp; 3<SUP>rd</SUP> Quarter</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="75%"><FONT SIZE=2>The participant's payout for the period prior to the effective date of the transfer will be based on the old Plan. The participant's payout after the effective date of the transfers will be based on the overall MIP
results of the old goals or the new goals, whichever result in a higher payout for the participant. For this comparison, the calculation of the payout for the old goals will be based on the same level of payout the employee would have received if the
employee had not been transferred including their prior salary and target incentive level.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="23%"><FONT SIZE=2>4<SUP>th</SUP> Quarter</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="75%"><FONT SIZE=2>Payout is based on the old MIP goals for the entire fiscal year</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT></P>

</DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>E.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Death.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;If a participant dies during the fiscal year, the participant's heirs as determined by will or applicable laws
of descent and distribution has a pro-rata calculation of payment based upon the time the participant served in the eligible position during the fiscal year.</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>X.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;COMPLIANCE WITH SECTION 162(M) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>If
a current Plan year payout causes the participant's total cash compensation to exceed one million dollars in the Fiscal Year, the participant must defer the portion that exceeds the one million
dollars in the ADC Telecommunications Deferred Compensation Plan.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>XI.&nbsp;&nbsp;AMENDMENT OR TERMINATION OF PLAN</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Board of Directors reserves and retains the right to modify, rescind or terminate this plan in whole or in part, at its sole discretion, and nothing in this Plan limits this right in any way or
creates any rights in any employee of future participation in this Plan or any other plan, or constitutes any guarantee of compensation or employment with ADC. Further, neither the Board of Directors
nor the Company has any obligation under this Plan or otherwise to adopt this or any other plan in any future fiscal year.
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=5,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="3",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]DG3280A.;16',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->
</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="4",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]DO3280A.;30',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->

<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="do3280_adc_telecommunications,_inc._e__adc02817_1"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.<BR> EXECUTIVE INCENTIVE EXCHANGE PLAN<BR> FISCAL YEAR 2000  </B></FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="78%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>I.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
PLAN NAME AND EFFECTIVE DATE</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The name of this Plan is the ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. ("Company") Executive Incentive Exchange Plan&#151;Fiscal Year 2000 ("FY 2000"), effective November&nbsp;1,
1999 through October&nbsp;31, 2000.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>II.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
PURPOSE</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The purpose of the Plan is to provide exceptional rewards for exceptional performance of eligible executives, align executive rewards with shareholder interests, and provide
an incentive for retention.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>III.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
ADMINISTRATION</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>This Plan will be administered by the same Committee ("Committee") appointed and authorized by the Company's Board of Directors to administer the Company's 1991 Stock
Incentive Plan. The Committee is authorized to make all decisions as required in administration of the Plan and to exercise its discretion to define, interpret, construe, apply, and make any exceptions to the terms of the Plan.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>IV.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
STOCK OPTION ISSUANCE</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>All stock options issued under this Plan will be granted under the Company's 1991 Stock Incentive Plan and/or its successor plans.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>V.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
ELIGIBILITY</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The Committee will establish rules of eligibility for participation in the Plan in accordance with the 1991 Stock Incentive Plan and determine eligibility in accordance with
those rules. Eligibility is limited to Corporate and Divisional Vice Presidents who receive approval from the Chief Executive Officer for participation in the Fiscal Year Plan. All Plan participants must also be participants under the Company's
Management Incentive Plan ("MIP"). No employee will become a participant after November&nbsp;1, 1999.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>VI.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
PLAN GOALS AND ACHIEVEMENT</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>All goals and objectives under this Plan shall be identical to the goals and objectives stated in each participant's MIP. Total payouts are calculated in the same fashion as
payouts made under the applicable MIP.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>VII.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
EXCHANGE ELECTION</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Prior to the beginning of FY 2000, participants may irrevocably elect to exchange up to 50% of their FY 2000 MIP award for options to purchase common stock of the Company.
Such elections may be made in 10% increments up to a maximum of 50% of the cash MIP award. No exchange will be made if the portion elected for exchange is less than One Hundred Dollars ($100.00).</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>VIII.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
EXCHANGE DATE</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Exchanges made under this Plan will be made as soon as administratively feasible following the close of FY 2000 and as soon as MIP awards are approved.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>IX.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
EXCHANGE CALCULATION</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The MIP award that will be used to calculate the exchange to options will be the incentive amount eligible to be paid for the fiscal year.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
The dollar amount of the MIP award elected to be exchanged will first be multiplied by an exchange factor ("Factor") of six (6). This amount is then divided by the Black-Scholes value of an option to purchase one share of ADC common stock on the last
day of FY 1999 to determine the number of option shares to be received by the participant.
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="4",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]DO3280B.;38',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
This Black-Scholes value will reflect the vesting characteristics of the options to be granted under this Plan and other characteristics as appropriate, and as such may differ from the Black-Scholes value applied for other options granted under other
Company plans. The final number of shares will be rounded down if necessary to the nearest whole share.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
This exchange causes payment of the MIP cash incentive amount exchanged to be forfeited, except as described under Section&nbsp;XIV.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>X.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
NATURE OF OPTIONS TO BE GRANTED</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>All options granted under this Plan will be nonqualified stock options, that are not "incentive stock options" within the meaning of Section&nbsp;422 of the Internal Revenue
Code of 1986, as amended.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>XI.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
TERM AND VESTING OF OPTIONS</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>All options granted under this Plan will have a term and method of exercise as determined by the Committee. The term will be 10&nbsp;years from the date of grant. Options
will vest in three (3)&nbsp;equal annual installments, beginning one (1)&nbsp;year after the grant date.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>XII.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
EXERCISE PRICE OF OPTIONS</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The exercise price of the stock options granted under this Plan will be the Fair Market Value of the Company's common stock on the last business day of the fiscal year and
be determined in accordance with the 1991 Stock Incentive Plan.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>XIII.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
STOCK OPTION GRANT DATE</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The effective date of the stock options granted under the Plan will be the last business day of the fiscal year.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>XIV.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
EFFECT OF CHANGE IN EMPLOYMENT STATUS ON CURRENT YEAR ELECTIONS (CHANGES DURING THE PLAN YEAR)</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
A.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Termination of Employment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;A participant who terminates employment prior to the end of FY 2000 will relinquish all rights to the grant of any stock option
under this plan and will forfeit the MIP cash equivalent amount as defined in his/her irrevocable exchange election.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
B.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Change in Job Status Based Upon a Demotion.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;A participant who is demoted from an eligible position under this Plan to an ineligible position will exchange the
pro-rata portion of cash MIP award that is calculated according to the time served in the eligible position during FY 2000, provided at least three months was served in the eligible position.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
C.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Death.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;If a participant dies during FY 2000, the participant's heirs as determined by will or applicable laws of descent and distribution will have no right to
receive any stock options under this plan. Heirs will receive instead the cash equivalent of the pro-rata MIP award that is calculated according to the MIP Plan, but not subject to the Factor.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>XV.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
EFFECT OF CHANGE IN EMPLOYMENT STATUS OCCURRING AFTER FY 2000 ON EXCHANGES MADE IN FY 2000</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>All stock options already awarded under this Plan will vest fully upon a participant's death, disability, or voluntary retirement. For purposes of this Plan, retirement from
the Company shall be defined as having attained age 55 with 10&nbsp;years of service with the Company ("early retirement"), or age 65 with 5&nbsp;years of service with the Company ("normal retirement").</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
If a participant terminates for any other reason, termination provisions will be applied. For each grant or exchange already made, if the participant terminates prior to the vesting of the first one third of the options, all options and the MIP cash
equivalent amount will be immediately forfeited. If the participant terminates after the first one third of the options have vested, all vested options will remain exercisable for a period of one (1)&nbsp;year. All unvested options will be forfeited,
and no cash equivalent will be provided.
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="4",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]DO3280B.;38',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>XVI.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
EFFECT OF CHANGE IN CONTROL ON EXCHANGES ALREADY MADE</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>In the event of a change in control of the Company as referenced in stock option agreements issued pursuant to this Plan, all unvested options will immediately vest in
full.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>XVII.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR>
AMENDMENT OR TERMINATION OF PLAN</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The Board of Directors reserves and retains the right to modify, rescind or terminate this Plan in whole or in part, at its sole discretion, and nothing in this Plan limits
this right in any way or creates any rights in any employee in future participation in this Plan or any other Plan, or constitutes any guarantee of compensation or employment with ADC. Further, neither the Board of Directors nor the Company has any
obligation under this Plan or otherwise to adopt this or any other plan in any future fiscal year.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>

</TR>

<H2><FONT SIZE=3 > </FONT></H2>
<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="dq3280_attachment_i_exchange_example"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ATTACHMENT I<BR> EXCHANGE EXAMPLE  </B></FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<CENTER><TABLE WIDTH="63%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Assumptions</I></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Annual earnings for FY 2000:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>$100,000</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Exchange election:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>50% of MIP award</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>MIP award:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>$30,000</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>*FMV of stock on 10/29/99:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>$40.00</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Black-Scholes factor for option on 10/29/99:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>.60 (actual factor will vary)</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Black-Scholes value of option on 10/29/99:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>$40.00&times; .60 = $24.00</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>*Exercise price of option (10/31/00):</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>$46.00</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Grant date:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>October 31, 2000</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></CENTER>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*Last
business day of the fiscal year 2000</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exchange Calculation</I></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>MIP Award &times; Exchange Election &times; Exchange Factor </U>=<BR>
Black-Scholes Value of Option on 10/30/98</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><U>$30,000
&times; 50% &times; 6</U> =<BR>
$40.00 &times; .60</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><U>$90,000</U>
=<BR>
$24.00&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3,750
options at an exercise price of $46.00 per share</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Vesting</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>1,250
shares vest on 10/31/01</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>1,250
shares vest on 10/31/02</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>1,250
shares vest on 10/31/03</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Five Year Projected Value of Award</I></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Assume
10% annual stock price appreciation</FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Assumed
stock price 10/31/05&nbsp;= $74.08</FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>5&nbsp;year
gain: $74.08 - $46.00 (exercise price)&nbsp;= $28.08</FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Projected
value: 3,750&nbsp;&times;&nbsp;$28.08&nbsp;= $105,300 vs. $15,000 original amount exchanged</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=5,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="4",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]DQ3280A.;17',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->
</FONT></P>

</DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="dq3280_adc_telecommunications,_inc._f__adc03367"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.<BR> FY 2000 MANAGEMENT INCENTIVE PLAN<BR> PAYOUT DISTRIBUTION OPTIONS  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>I
hereby make the following irrevocable elections for the current plan year:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>I.&nbsp;&nbsp;2000 Executive Incentive Exchange Plan (Check and complete one line only)</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>&nbsp;I
wish to have 100% of my incentive paid under the terms of the ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. Management Incentive Plan; or:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>&nbsp;I
wish to participate in the Executive Incentive Exchange Plan and receive <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> %
(at least 50%, in a multiple of 10%) of my annual MIP award to be paid under the terms of the Management Incentive Plan, and to receive stock options based upon a value equal to
<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> % of my annual MIP award up to 50% in accordance with the Executive Incentive Exchange Plan, except that no exchange will be made if the portion elected
for exchange is less than One Hundred Dollars ($100.00).</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>II.&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred Compensation Plan</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>A.&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred Compensation Election Amount (Check and complete one line only)</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Of
the cash amount remaining after my election in Section&nbsp;I above, I elect:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>&nbsp;To
defer none of this remaining annual cash MIP award under the Deferred Compensation Plan (no deferral); or:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>&nbsp;To
defer <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> % of this remaining annual cash MIP award under the Deferred
Compensation Plan, except that no deferral will be made if the portion elected for deferral is less than One Hundred Dollars ($100.00); or:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>&nbsp;To
defer one hundred percent (100%) of the balance over $<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> of the remaining
annual cash MIP award under the Deferred Compensation Plan, except that the amount hereby excluded from deferral shall not be less than One Hundred Dollars ($100.00).</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>B.&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred Compensation Distribution Option</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>This
section should only be completed if you have elected to defer a portion of your FY 2000 Management Incentive Payout under the Deferred Compensation Plan (Section&nbsp;IIA above). Because of the
potential tax implications at distribution, you may want to consult a tax advisor.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>At
termination of employment, I elect to have my deferred compensation account balance distributed:</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>&nbsp;In
a lump sum; or</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>&nbsp;In
ten equal annual installments (This installment form will be available only if the single lump sum value of my benefit
at termination is at least $100,000.)</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<BR><BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I
hereby certify that I have been given a copy of all applicable plan documents, that I have read them, and that I understand their provisions.</FONT></P>

Agent Lessor on or following the signature page hereof.</FONT></P>

<H2><FONT SIZE=3 > </FONT></H2>
<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ec3280_lease"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>LEASE  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS DOCUMENT SECURES FUTURE ADVANCES</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Lease (this "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lease</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), dated as of October&nbsp;22, 1999, between LEASE PLAN NORTH AMERICA,&nbsp;INC.,
not in its individual capacity except as expressly stated herein, but solely as agent for the Participants (in such capacity, together with its successor and assigns in such capacity, the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Agent Lessor</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), having its principal office at 135 South LaSalle Street, Chicago, Illinois 60674, as Agent Lessor and as Mortgagee, and ADC
TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC., a Minnesota corporation, having a principal office at 12501 Whitewater Drive, Minnetonka, Minnesota 55343, as Lessee and as Mortgagor (the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lessee</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>W I T N E S S E T H:</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.&nbsp;&nbsp;Lessee
has acquired record title to the parcel of land located in Eden Prairie, Minnesota, and as more particularly described on</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Exhibit&nbsp;A&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>hereto, together with all Appurtenant Rights thereto
(the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Land</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B.&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject
to the terms and conditions set forth in the Operative Documents, (i)&nbsp;Lessee and Agent Lessor have entered into a Ground Lease pursuant to which
Lessee will lease the Land to Lessor commencing on the initial Advance Date; (ii)&nbsp;during the Construction Period, Construction Agent, using Advances funded by the Participants, will construct
the Financed Improvements on behalf of Agent Lessor; and (iii)&nbsp;pursuant to this Lease, Agent Lessor will sublease the Land and lease the Financed Improvements to Lessee, and Lessee will lease
the Premises from Agent Lessor.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing, and of other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree
as follows:</FONT></P>

<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ec3280_article_i_definitions"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE I<BR> DEFINITIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
1.1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions; Interpretation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;For all purposes hereof, the capitalized terms used herein
and not otherwise defined shall have the meanings assigned thereto in Appendix&nbsp;1 to that certain Participation Agreement dated as of even date herewith, among ADC
Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc., as Lessee, Lease Plan North America,&nbsp;Inc., not in its individual capacity except as expressly stated therein, but solely as Agent Lessor for the Participants,
ABN AMRO Bank N.V., not in its individual capacity except as expressly stated therein, but solely as Administrative Agent for the Participants, and the Persons named on Schedule&nbsp;I thereto, as
Participants (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Participation Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"); and the rules of interpretation set forth in</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Appendix&nbsp;1
&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>to the Participation Agreement shall apply to this Lease. Except as specifically provided for in</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;16.6
&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>hereof, all obligations imposed on the "Lessee" in this Lease shall be the full recourse liability of Lessee.</FONT></P>

<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ec3280_article_ii_lease_of_premises;_lease_term"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE II<BR> LEASE OF PREMISES; LEASE TERM  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
2.1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Acceptance and Lease of the Premises.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Agent Lessor, subject to the satisfaction or waiver
of the conditions set forth in Article&nbsp;VI of the Participation Agreement, hereby agrees to accept delivery of the Land on the initial Advance Date pursuant to the Ground Lease and the Financed
Improvements pursuant to the terms of the Participation Agreement and the Construction Agency Agreement and to lease all of Agent Lessor's interest in the Premises to Lessee hereunder, and Lessee
hereby agrees, expressly for the direct benefit of Agent Lessor, to lease the Premises from Agent Lessor for the Term.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
2.2.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Acceptance Procedure.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Agent Lessor hereby authorizes one or more employees of Lessee, to
be designated by Lessee, as the authorized representative or representatives of Agent Lessor to accept delivery of the Premises, including without limitation the Financed Improvements to be
constructed. Lessee hereby agrees that the execution and delivery by Lessee of the Memorandum of

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=5,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]EC3280A.;6',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->
Lease (in the form of</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Exhibit&nbsp;B</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) with respect to the Land and all Financed Improvements to be constructed thereon during the Term
shall, without further act, constitute the irrevocable acceptance by Lessee of the Land and all such Financed Improvements for all purposes of this Lease and the other Operative Documents on the terms
set forth therein and herein.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
2.3.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Term.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless earlier terminated, the term of this Lease shall consist of (a)&nbsp;an
interim period (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Interim Term</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") commencing on and including the Document Closing Date and ending on but not including the Base Term Commencement
Date, (b)&nbsp;a base term (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Base Term</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") commencing on and including the Base Term Commencement Date and ending on but not including the fifth
anniversary of the Document Closing Date, and (c)&nbsp;if exercised and approved pursuant to each of the terms and conditions of Section&nbsp;4.4 of the Participation Agreement and exercised
pursuant to the terms of this Lease, including</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Article&nbsp;XIX&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>hereof, each Lease Renewal Term (the Interim Term, the
Base Term and the Lease Renewal Terms, if any, collectively, the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Term</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
2.4.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Title.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The Premises are leased to Lessee without any representation or warranty, express
or implied, by Agent Lessor and subject to the rights of parties in possession, the existing state of title with respect thereto (including, without limitation, all Liens other than Lessor Liens) and
all applicable Requirements of Law and any violations thereof. Lessee shall in no event have any recourse against Agent Lessor for any defect in or exception to title to the Premises other than
resulting from Lessor Liens or a breach by Agent Lessor of its obligations under</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Article&nbsp;XXI</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.</FONT></P>

<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ec3280_article_iii_payment_of_rent"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE III<BR> PAYMENT OF RENT  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
3.1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Rent; Loan to Value Optional Prepayment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;During
the Term, Lessee shall pay Basic Rent on each Payment Date, on the date required under</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;20.1(j)
&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>in connection with Lessee's exercise of the Sale Option and on any date on which this Lease shall terminate with respect to the Premises; provided, however,
that Basic Rent payable prior to the Base Term Commencement Date shall be payable through Advances under Article&nbsp;III of the Participation Agreement. Until otherwise directed in writing by Agent
Lessor, all payments of Rent shall be made to the Administrative Agent as set forth on Schedule&nbsp;II to the Participation Agreement.</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;Lessee
shall advise Agent Lessor (who shall then notify the Tranche A2 Participants and the Tranche A3 Participants) by irrevocable written notice, that Lessee
desires to extend the Scheduled Liquidity Termination Date for an additional 364&nbsp;days,</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;provided&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>such request is
made not more than 90&nbsp;days prior to, and not less than 60&nbsp;days prior to, the Scheduled Liquidity Termination Date then in effect. Beginning with the notice to be delivered for the
Scheduled Liquidity Termination Date occurring on or following the Completion Date, each such notice shall also (i)&nbsp;state whether or not Lessee intends to make the Loan to Value Optional Rent
Prepayment on the Loan to Value Prepayment Date as
described in the following sentence and (ii)&nbsp;be accompanied by the appraisal required by Section&nbsp;8.1(t) of the Participation Agreement. If Lessee has elected in such notice to make the
Loan to Value Optional Rent Prepayment, then Lessee shall, on the Payment Date immediately preceding the next one-year anniversary of the Document Closing Date (such Payment Date the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Loan to Value Prepayment Date</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), pay to Agent Lessor as Supplemental Rent an amount (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Loan to Value Optional Rent
Prepayment</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") sufficient, when applied to the outstanding Tranche A Certificate Amounts pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.3 of the Participation Agreement, to reduce the Loan to
Value Ratio to the Maximum Loan to Value Ratio after giving effect to such payment. Such payment shall be accompanied by an Officer's Certificate from Lessee setting forth the calculation of the Loan
to Value Ratio immediately prior to and after giving effect to such payment.

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=6,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",FOLIO=2,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]EC3280A.;6',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->
</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;Basic
Rent shall be due and payable in lawful money of the United States and shall be paid directly by Lessee to the account designated by Agent Lessor by wire
transfer of immediately available funds on the due date therefor.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;Lessee's
inability or failure to take possession of all or any portion of the Premises when delivered by Agent Lessor, whether or not attributable to any act or
omission of Lessee or any act or omission of Agent Lessor, shall not delay or otherwise affect Lessee's obligation to pay Rent in accordance with the terms of this Lease.</FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
3.2.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment of Basic Rent.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Basic Rent shall be paid absolutely net to Agent Lessor, so that
this Lease shall yield to Agent Lessor the full amount thereof, without setoff, deduction or reduction.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
3.3.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Supplemental Rent.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Lessee shall pay to Agent Lessor or the Person entitled thereto any and
all Supplemental Rent promptly as the same shall become due and payable, and if Lessee fails to pay any Supplemental Rent, Agent Lessor shall have all rights, powers and remedies provided for herein
or by law or equity or otherwise in the case of nonpayment of Basic Rent;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;provided, however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that except as provided in
Section&nbsp;3.2(c) of the Participation Agreement, Supplemental Rent payable prior to the Base Term Commencement Date, to the extent provided for in the Approved Construction Budget, shall be
payable with Advances pursuant to and subject to the terms of Article&nbsp;III of the Participation Agreement. Lessee shall pay to Agent Lessor, as Supplemental Rent, among other things, on demand,
to the extent permitted by applicable Requirements of Law, interest at the applicable Overdue Rate on any installment of Basic Rent not paid when due for the period for which the same shall be overdue
and on any payment of Supplemental Rent payable to Agent Lessor or any Indemnitee not paid when due or demanded by Agent Lessor or any Indemnitee for the period from the due date or the date of any
such demand, as the case may be, until the same shall be paid. The expiration or other termination of Lessee's obligations to pay Basic Rent hereunder shall not limit or modify the obligations of
Lessee with respect to Supplemental Rent. Unless expressly provided otherwise in this Lease, in the event of any failure on the part of Lessee to pay and discharge any Supplemental Rent as and when
due, Lessee shall also promptly pay and discharge any fine, penalty, interest or cost which may be assessed or added under any agreement with a third party or otherwise for nonpayment or late payment
of such Supplemental Rent, all of which shall also constitute Supplemental Rent.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
3.4.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Method of Payment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Each payment of Rent shall be made by Lessee to Agent Lessor prior to
12:00 noon, New York City time to the account of Agent Lessor designated on Schedule&nbsp;II to the Participation Agreement in funds consisting of lawful currency of the United States of America
which shall be immediately available on the scheduled date when such payment shall be due, unless such scheduled date shall not be a Business Day, in which case such payment shall be made on the next
succeeding Business Day unless the result of such extension would be to carry into another
calendar month, in which case such payment shall be made on the immediately preceding Business Day. Payments received after 12:00 noon, New York City time on the date due shall for the purpose
of</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;16.1&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>hereof be deemed received on such day; provided, however, that for the purposes of the second
sentence of</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3.3&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>hereof, such payments shall be deemed received on the next succeeding Business Day and
subject to interest at the Overdue Rate as provided in such</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3.3</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.</FONT></P>

<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ec3280_article_iv_quiet_enjoyment;_right_to_inspect"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE IV<BR> QUIET ENJOYMENT; RIGHT TO INSPECT  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
4.1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Non-Interference.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to Agent Lessor's cure rights, as provided for
in</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;17.1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Agent Lessor covenants that it will not interfere in Lessee's use or possession of the Premises during the Term,
so long as no Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, it being agreed that Lessee's remedies for breach of the foregoing covenant shall be limited to the
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=7,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",FOLIO=3,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]EC3280A.;6',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->
commencement of proceedings to enjoin such breach. Such right is independent of and shall not affect Lessee's obligations hereunder and under the other Operative Documents or Agent Lessor's rights
otherwise to initiate legal action to enforce the obligations of Lessee under this Lease. The foregoing covenant shall not require Agent Lessor to take any action contrary to, or which would permit
Lessee to use the Premises for a use not permitted under, the provisions of this Lease.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
4.2.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Inspection and Reports.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Upon
five (5)&nbsp;Business Days prior notice to Lessee, Agent Lessor or its authorized representatives (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Inspecting
Parties</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") at any time during the Term may inspect (a)&nbsp;the Premises and (b)&nbsp;the books and records of Lessee relating to the Premises and (subject to appropriate
confidentiality arrangements) make copies and abstracts therefrom. All such inspections shall be during Lessee's normal business hours (unless an Event of Default has occurred and is existing), shall
be subject to Lessee's customary safety and security provisions and shall be at the expense and risk of the Inspecting Parties, except that if an Event of Default or Default has occurred and is
continuing, Lessee shall reimburse the Inspecting Parties for the reasonable costs of such inspections and, except for the Inspecting Party's gross negligence or willful misconduct, such inspection
shall be at Lessee's risk. No inspection shall unreasonably interfere with Lessee's operations. None of the Inspecting Parties shall have any duty to make any such inspection or inquiry. None of the
Inspecting Parties shall incur any liability or obligation by reason of making any such inspection or inquiry unless and to the extent such Inspecting Party causes damage to the Premises or any
property of Lessee or any other Person during the course of such inspection.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;To
the extent permissible under Applicable Laws, during the Term, Lessee shall prepare and file in timely fashion, or, where Agent Lessor shall be required to file,
Lessee shall prepare and make available to Agent Lessor within a reasonable time prior to the date for filing and Agent Lessor shall file, any reports with respect to the condition or operation of the
Premises that shall be required to be filed with any Governmental Authority.</FONT></P>

<BR>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ec3280_article_v_net_lease,_etc."> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE V<BR> NET LEASE, ETC.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
5.1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Net Lease.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;This Lease shall constitute a net lease and Lessee's obligations to pay all
Rent shall be absolute and unconditional under any and all circumstances. Any present or future law to the
contrary notwithstanding, this Lease shall not terminate, nor shall Lessee be entitled to any abatement, suspension, deferment, reduction, setoff, counterclaim, or defense with respect to the Rent,
nor shall the obligations of Lessee hereunder be affected (except as expressly herein permitted and by performance of the obligations in connection therewith) by reason of: (i)&nbsp;any defect in
the condition, merchantability, design, construction, quality or fitness for use of the Premises or any part thereof, or the failure of the Premises to comply with all Requirements of Law, including
any inability to occupy or use the Premises by reason of such non-compliance; (ii)&nbsp;any damage to, removal, abandonment, salvage, loss, contamination of, or Release from, scrapping
or destruction of or any requisition or taking of the Premises or any part thereof; (iii)&nbsp;any restriction, prevention or curtailment of or interference with any use of the Premises or any part
thereof including eviction; (iv)&nbsp;any defect in title to or rights to the Premises or any Lien on such title or rights or on the Premises (provided, that the foregoing shall not relieve any
Person from its responsibility to remove Lessor Liens attributable to it); (v)&nbsp;any change, waiver, extension, indulgence or other action or omission or breach in respect of any obligation or
liability of or by Agent Lessor or any Participant; (vi)&nbsp;to the fullest extent permitted by Applicable Laws, any bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, composition, adjustment, dissolution,
liquidation or other like proceedings relating to Lessee, Agent Lessor, any Participant or any other Person, or any action taken with respect to this Lease by any trustee or receiver of Lessee, Agent
Lessor, any Participant or any other Person, or by any court, in any such proceeding; (vii)&nbsp;any claim that Lessee has or might have against any Person, including without limitation Agent
Lessor, any
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=8,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",FOLIO=4,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]EC3280B.;5',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->
Participant, or any vendor, manufacturer, contractor of or for the Premises; (viii)&nbsp;any failure on the part of Agent Lessor to perform or comply with any of the terms of this Lease, of any
other Operative Document or of any other agreement; (ix)&nbsp;any invalidity or unenforceability or illegality or disaffirmance of this Lease against or by Lessee or any provision hereof or any of
the other Operative Documents or any provision of any thereof; (x)&nbsp;the impossibility or illegality of performance by Lessee, Agent Lessor or both; (xi)&nbsp;any action by any court,
administrative agency or other Governmental Authority; (xii)&nbsp;any restriction, prevention or curtailment of or interference with the construction on or any use of the Premises or any part
thereof; (xiii)&nbsp;the failure of Lessee to achieve any accounting or tax benefits or the characterization of the transaction intended by the parties as set forth at</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;24.1&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>and
Section&nbsp;5.1 of the Participation Agreement; or (xiv)&nbsp;any other cause or circumstances whether similar or
dissimilar to the foregoing and whether or not Lessee shall have notice or knowledge of any of the foregoing. Lessee's agreement in the preceding sentence shall not affect any claim, action or right
Lessee may have against any Person. The parties intend that the obligations of Lessee hereunder shall be covenants and agreements that are separate and independent from any obligations of Agent Lessor
hereunder or under any other Operative Documents and the obligations of Lessee shall continue unaffected unless such obligations shall have been modified or terminated in accordance with an express
provision of this Lease.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
5.2.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;No Termination or Abatement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Lessee shall remain obligated under this Lease in accordance
with its terms and the terms of the other Operative Documents and shall not take any action to terminate, rescind or avoid this Lease to the fullest extent permitted by Applicable Laws,
notwithstanding any action for bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, liquidation, dissolution, or other proceeding affecting Lessee, Agent Lessor or any Participant, or any action with respect to
this Lease which may be taken by any trustee, receiver or liquidator of Lessee, Agent Lessor or any Participant or by any court with respect to Lessee, Agent Lessor, Administrative Agent or any
Participant. Lessee hereby waives all right to terminate or surrender this Lease (except as provided herein) or to avail itself of any abatement, suspension, deferment, reduction, setoff, counterclaim
or defense with respect to any Rent. Lessee shall remain obligated under this Lease in accordance with its terms and the terms of the other Operative Documents and Lessee hereby waives any and all
rights now or hereafter conferred by statute or otherwise to modify or to avoid strict compliance with its obligations under this
Lease. Notwithstanding any such statute or otherwise, Lessee shall be bound by all of the terms and conditions contained in this Lease.</FONT></P>

<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ec3280_article_vi_subleases;_space_leases"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VI<BR> SUBLEASES; SPACE LEASES  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except for subleases permitted by this</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Article&nbsp;VI</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Lessee during the Term may not
assign, sublease, mortgage or pledge to any Person, including an Affiliate of Lessee, at any time, in whole or in part, any of its right, title or interest in, to or under this Lease, or any portion
of the Premises, or permit any portion of the Premises to be used or occupied by any other Person, in any case without the prior written consent of the Required Participants, and any such assignment,
sublease, mortgage or pledge shall be void. Lessee may not sublease, in whole or in part, any of its right, title or interest in, to or under this Lease or any portion of the Premises to any Person,
or permit any portion of the Premises to be used or occupied by any other Person, except that, following the Base Term Commencement Date, Lessee may enter into subleases (each, a
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Sublease</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") of the Premises (together with the nonexclusive use of any related or necessary portion of the Land as necessary for access and parking).
With respect to any sublease permitted under this</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Article&nbsp;VI</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Lessee shall not sublease any portion of the Premises to, or permit
the sublease of any portion of the Premises to, or permit the sublease of any portion of the Premises by, any Person who shall then be engaged in any proceedings for relief under any bankruptcy or
insolvency law or laws relating to the relief of debtors. No sublease hereunder will discharge or diminish any of Lessee's obligations to Agent Lessor hereunder or to any other Person under any other
Operative Document, and Lessee shall remain directly and primarily liable under this
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=9,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",FOLIO=5,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]EC3280B.;5',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->
Lease with respect to the entire Premises. Each sublease permitted hereby shall be made and shall expressly provide that it is subject and subordinate to this Lease and the rights of Agent Lessor
hereunder, and shall expressly provide for the surrender of the space subleased by the applicable sublessee at the election of Agent Lessor after a Lease Event of Default or upon any termination or
expiration of this Lease, unless Lessee purchases the Premises pursuant to Article&nbsp;XVIII or</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;19.1(b)
&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of this Lease. Lessee shall give Agent Lessor prompt written notice of any sublease permitted under this</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Article&nbsp;VI</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, and Lessee shall, within fifteen (15)
&nbsp;days following the execution of any sublease, deliver to Agent Lessor a fully executed copy of
such sublease.</FONT></P>

<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ec3280_article_vii_lessee_acknowledgments"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VII<BR> LESSEE ACKNOWLEDGMENTS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
7.1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Condition of the Premises.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;LESSEE ACKNOWLEDGES AND AGREES THAT ALTHOUGH AGENT LESSOR WILL
OWN AND HOLD TITLE TO THE IMPROVEMENTS, LESSEE, ACTING AS CONSTRUCTION AGENT, IS SOLELY RESPONSIBLE UNDER THE TERMS OF THE CONSTRUCTION AGENCY AGREEMENT FOR THE DESIGN, DEVELOPMENT, BUDGETING,
ACQUISITION AND CONSTRUCTION OF THE PREMISES AND ANY ALTERATIONS OR MODIFICATIONS AND ALL ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED IN CONNECTION THEREWITH. LESSEE FURTHER ACKNOWLEDGES AND AGREES THAT IT IS LEASING THE
PREMISES "AS IS" WITHOUT REPRESENTATION, WARRANTY OR COVENANT (EXPRESS OR IMPLIED) BY AGENT LESSOR, ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT OR THE PARTICIPANTS AND IN EACH CASE SUBJECT TO (A)&nbsp;THE EXISTING STATE
OF TITLE (EXCLUDING LESSOR LIENS), (B)&nbsp;THE RIGHTS OF ANY PARTIES IN POSSESSION THEREOF, (C)&nbsp;ANY STATE OF FACTS WHICH AN ACCURATE SURVEY OR PHYSICAL INSPECTION MIGHT SHOW, AND
(D)&nbsp;VIOLATIONS OF REQUIREMENTS OF LAW WHICH MAY EXIST ON THE DATE HEREOF OR AT ANY TIME. NONE OF AGENT LESSOR, ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT OR ANY PARTICIPANT HAS MADE OR SHALL BE DEEMED TO
HAVE MADE ANY REPRESENTATION, WARRANTY OR COVENANT (EXPRESS OR IMPLIED) OR SHALL BE DEEMED TO HAVE ANY LIABILITY WHATSOEVER AS TO THE TITLE (OTHER THAN FOR LESSOR LIENS), VALUE, HABITABILITY, USE,
CONDITION, DESIGN, OPERATION, OR FITNESS FOR USE OF THE PREMISES (OR ANY PART THEREOF), OR ANY OTHER REPRESENTATION, WARRANTY OR COVENANT WHATSOEVER, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, WITH RESPECT TO THE PREMISES
(OR ANY PART THEREOF) AND NONE OF AGENT LESSOR, ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT OR ANY PARTICIPANT SHALL BE LIABLE FOR ANY LATENT, HIDDEN, OR PATENT DEFECT THEREIN (OTHER THAN FOR LESSOR LIENS) OR THE FAILURE OF
THE PREMISES, OR ANY PART THEREOF, TO COMPLY WITH ANY REQUIREMENT OF LAW. Lessee has been afforded full opportunity to inspect the Premises, is satisfied with the results of its inspections and is
entering into this Lease solely on the basis of the results of its own inspections, and all risks incident to the matters discussed in the preceding sentence, as between Agent Lessor, Administrative
Agent and the Participants, on the one hand, and Lessee, on the other, are to be borne by Lessee. The provisions of this</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;7.1
&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>have been negotiated, and, except to the extent otherwise expressly stated, the foregoing provisions are intended to be a complete exclusion and negation of any
representations or warranties by any of Agent Lessor, Administrative Agent or the Participants, express or implied, with respect to the Premises (or any interest therein), that may arise pursuant to
any law now or hereafter in effect or otherwise.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
7.2.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Risk of Loss.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;During the Term and subject to the limitations set forth
in</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;14.1(e)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the risk of loss of or decrease in the enjoyment and beneficial use of the Premises as a result of the damage
or destruction thereof by fire, the elements, casualties, thefts, riots, wars or otherwise is assumed by Lessee, and neither Agent Lessor nor any Participant shall in no event be answerable or
accountable therefor.
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=10,EFW="9930982",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",FOLIO=6,FILE='DISK039:[99STP0.99STP3280]EC3280B.;5',USER='CTAFT',CD='30-DEC-1999;08:05' -->
</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
7.3.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain Duties and Responsibilities of Agent Lessor.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Agent Lessor undertakes to perform
such duties and only such duties as are specifically set forth herein and in the other Operative Documents, and no implied covenants or obligations shall be read into this Lease against Agent Lessor,
and Agent Lessor agrees that it shall not, nor shall it have a duty to, manage, control, use, sell, maintain, insure, register, lease, operate, modify, dispose of or otherwise deal with the Premises
or any other part of the Collateral in any manner whatsoever, except as required by the terms of the Operative Documents and as otherwise provided herein.</FONT></P>

<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ec3280_article_viii_possession_and_use_of_the_property,_etc."> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VIII<BR> POSSESSION AND USE OF THE PROPERTY, ETC.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
8.1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Utility and Other Charges.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;During the Term and subject to the limitations set forth at
Section&nbsp;3.3 with respect to such charges payable during the Interim Term, Lessee shall pay or cause to be paid, as Supplemental Rent, all charges for electricity, power, gas, oil, water,
telephone, sanitary sewer service and all other rents and utilities used in or on the Premises during the Term. Lessee shall be entitled to receive any credit or refund with respect to any utility
charge paid by Lessee and the amount of any credit or refund received by Agent Lessor on account of any utility charges paid by Lessee, net of the costs and expenses reasonably incurred by Agent
Lessor in obtaining such credit or refund, shall be promptly paid over to Lessee. All charges for utilities imposed with respect to the Premises for a billing period during which this Lease expires or
terminates (except when Lessee purchases the Premises in accordance with the terms of this Lease, in which case Lessee shall be solely responsible for all such charges) shall be adjusted and prorated
on a daily basis between Lessee and
any purchaser of the Premises, and each party shall pay or reimburse the other for each party's pro rata share thereof;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that
in no event shall Agent Lessor have any liability therefor.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
8.2.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Possession and Use of the Premises.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The Premises shall be used only as a first class
commercial office building and for computer simulated and other dry research and development activities related to Lessee's business. Following the Base Term Commencement Date, the Leased Property
shall be continuously occupied by Lessee, or a permitted sublessee to the extent permitted herein, in the ordinary course of business. Lessee shall not use the Premises or any part thereof, or permit
the Premises to be used, for any purpose or in any manner that would adversely affect the Fair Market Value, utility, remaining useful life or residual value of the Premises. Lessee shall pay, or
cause to be paid, as Supplemental Rent, all charges and costs required in connection with the use of the Premises as contemplated by this Lease and the other Operative Documents. Lessee shall not
commit or permit any waste of the Premises or any part thereof.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
8.3.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Compliance with Requirements of Law and Insurance Requirements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the terms
of</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Article&nbsp;XII&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>relating to permitted contests, Lessee, at its sole cost and expense, shall comply in all material
respects with all Requirements of Law (including all Environmental Laws) and Insurance Requirements relating to the Premises, including the use, construction, operation, maintenance, repair and
restoration thereof and the remarketing thereof pursuant to</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Article&nbsp;XX</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, whether or not compliance therewith shall require
structural or extraordinary changes in the Premises or interfere with the use and enjoyment of the Premises, and procure, maintain and comply with all licenses, permits, orders, approvals, consents
and other authorizations required for the construction, use, maintenance and operation of the Premises and for the use, operation, maintenance, repair and restoration of the Improvements.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT></P>

<H2><FONT SIZE=3 > </FONT></H2>
<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ee3280_article_ix_maintenance_and_repair;_reports"> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE IX<BR> MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR; REPORTS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
9.1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Maintenance and Repair; Reports.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;On and after the Base Term Commencement Date, Lessee, at
its own expense, shall at all times (a)&nbsp;maintain the Premises in good repair and condition, subject to ordinary wear and tear, and as a first class office building subject to the other uses
permitted at</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;8.2</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, and in any event at least as good as the condition of similar buildings owned or leased by Lessee or
its Affiliates; (b)&nbsp;maintain the Premises in accordance with all Applicable Laws in all material respects, whether or not such maintenance requires structural modifications; (c)&nbsp;comply
in all material respects with the Insurance Requirements which are in effect at any time with respect to the Premises or any part thereof; (d)&nbsp;use the Premises only in accordance
with</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Article&nbsp;VIII</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>; (e)&nbsp;make all necessary or appropriate repairs, replacements and renewals of the Premises or any part
thereof which may be required to keep the Premises in the condition required by the preceding</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;clauses&nbsp;(a)
&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>through</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;(d)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, whether interior or exterior, structural or nonstructural, ordinary or
extraordinary, foreseen or unforeseen, and including, without limitation, repairs, replacements and renewals that would constitute capital expenditures under GAAP if incurred by an owner of property;
and (f)&nbsp;procure, maintain and comply in all material respects with all material licenses, permits, orders, approvals, consents and other authorizations required for the construction, use,
maintenance and operation of the Premises. Lessee waives any right that it may now have or hereafter acquire to (x)&nbsp;require Agent Lessor to maintain, repair, replace, alter, remove or rebuild
all or any part of the Premises or (y)&nbsp;make repairs at the expense of Agent Lessor pursuant to any Applicable Laws or other agreements.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
9.2.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Maintenance and Repair Reports.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;During the Term, Lessee shall keep maintenance and repair
reports in sufficient detail to indicate the nature and date of major work done. Such reports shall be kept on file by Lessee at its offices during the Term, and shall be made available at Lessee's
office to Agent Lessor upon reasonable request. Lessee shall give written notice to Agent Lessor of any Condemnation or Casualty promptly after Lessee has knowledge thereof.</FONT></P>

<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ee3280_article_x_modifications,_etc."> </A></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE X<BR> MODIFICATIONS, ETC.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECTION
10.1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Improvements and Modifications.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;In
addition to Lessee's obligations as Construction Agent to build the Financed Improvements under the Construction Agency Agreement, on and after the Base Term
Commencement Date (i)&nbsp;Lessee, at Lessee's own cost and expense, shall make alterations, renovations, improvements and additions to the Premises or any part thereof and substitutions and
replacements therefor (collectively, "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Modifications</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") which are (A)&nbsp;necessary to repair or maintain the Premises in the condition required
by</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;9.1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>; (B)&nbsp;necessary in order for the Premises to be in compliance in all material respects with Applicable Laws;
or (C)&nbsp;necessary or advisable to restore the Premises to their condition existing prior to a Casualty or Condemnation to the extent required pursuant to</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Article&nbsp;XIV</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>; and (ii)&nbsp;so long
as no Lease Event of Default or Lease Default has occurred and is continuing, Lessee, at Lessee's own cost and
expense, may undertake Modifications on the Premises so long as such Modifications comply with Applicable Laws and with</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;9.1
&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>and subsection (b)&nbsp;of this</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;Section&nbsp;10.1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. During the Interim Term, all
Modifications (other than the Financed Improvements being built pursuant to the Approved Plans and Specifications and in compliance with the Construction Agency Agreement, and any modification
permitted pursuant to and in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.2 of the Construction Agency Agreement) shall
be subject to the written approval of the Required Participants and the terms, conditions and restrictions set forth in the Construction Agency Agreement.

</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The
